author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1705775213}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164059091', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1706476556}
review:
모든 도전과제 4.7시간 컷

너무 밝아서 눈 아픈 네온 배경과 죽을 때마다 나오는 이상한 효과음, 눈에 거슬리는 노잼 농담문구들, 그리고 후반부에 동시에 4개의 네모를 조종해야하는 뇌절 레벨들 때문에 비추를 주려했으나

그래도 매우 널널한(레벨에 따라 들쭉날쭉 하긴 함) S랭크 시간과 클리어했을때의 보람이 커서 그리고 결정적으로 90퍼 할인할 때 산거라 추천드립니다

개인적으로 후반부의 레벨들은 난이도 면에서 점프킹과는 비교가 안되지만 빡침레벨은 비슷한 정도인듯 합니다

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1694284949}
review:
Binaries has a good idea - control two balls at the same time and guide them to their respective exits. It actually works, too, for a number of levels, but as you get further into the game and the level design changes, it gets almost impossibly frustrating. At a certain point in the game, the difficulty switches from having to keep track of two balls to dealing with the bad hitboxes, weird visual design choices and floaty controls, the death of any precision platformer. 

Balls get stuck on edges very easily, get hit by projectiles they barely touch, and have very weird physics when interacting with each other, which is a pain especially in the levels where one ball has to protect the other by rolling in front of it (as orange can't get hit by blue obstacles and vice versa). Jumping is very inaccurate as well. Or, in short: you can't control both balls as precisely as the game demands, so finishing a level (especially for S times) often comes down to luck later in the game.

I will say that Binaries does tickle the brain in a unique way, but the controls and level design just don't match a precision platformer, and the difficulty of having to keep track of two things at the same time becomes an illusion once you realize that it often just comes down to hoping that the wonky physics play along. If the level design was built more on the first couple levels, the game would have been a lot better imo. Unique gimmick or not, there are worse precision platformers out there, but there's also much better, especially for the original asking price of $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1684081631}
review:
Binaries, bir platform oyunu olan BAFTA adayı zorlu bir oyun olup reflekslerinizi ve farkındalığınızı test etmenizi sağlar. Oyunda iki sevimli topu aynı anda kontrol ederek 100'den fazla renkli zorlu bölümde ilerlemeye çalışırsınız. Her adımda ölüm ve tehlikeyle karşılaşmamak için her iki topu da aynı anda kontrol etmek zorundasınız.

Oyunda şakalar da bulunmaktadır. Ancak, notlarda belirtildiği gibi, topukları seven olmayabilir, hatta kelime bile olmayabilir ve şakalar komik olmayabilir.

Oyunun Özellikleri:

    100'den fazla seviyede zorlu bulmacaları çözün ve ölümcül zorluklarla karşılaşın.
    Kendinizi cezalandırmaktan hoşlanıyor musunuz? Zaman karşısında seviyeleri tekrar oynayarak en hızlı süreyi elde etmeye çalışın. Her seviyede S derecesini almak için yeterince hızlı mısınız? (Biz değiliz.)
    Başarılı olduğunuzda hızlanan ve sıkıştığınızda sakinleşen funky bir müzik skoru, konsantre olmanıza yardımcı olur. Oyun, başarılı olmanızı istiyor gibi bir his veriyor (sizi dikenlerle uğraşırken).
    Doğrusal olmayan bir harita üzerinden tamamlamak için kendi yolunuzu seçin. Süper zor bir aşamada takılı kaldınız mı? Endişelenmeyin! Sadece farklı bir seviyede becerilerinizi geliştirmek için gidin.
    En fazla on şaka eşliğinde gülebilirsiniz! Evet, komik olduğunu sürekli söyleyeceğiz. Siz zamanla ikna olursunuz. (Endişelenmeyin, on kezden fazla gülerseniz ekstra ücret alınmaz.)

Bu oyunun yapım aşamasında hiçbir kontrol cihazı zarar görmemiştir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1602014602}
review:
The jump feels extremely floaty and you can't properly control the jump height. I very quickly got annoyed by how difficult it is to control the 2 balls precisely. It appears you just have to find out by trial and error what the correct sequence of jumps is to get to the end of each level - and IMHO that is not how these games are suppopsed to work. This game is not for me.
Buy only if you like being punished. You don't often see games were most reviewers admit they were heavily frustrated while playing but still give it a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995202297', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1494696523}
review:
Binaries is one of that growing list of games you can file under 'tough platform game with a gimmick', but it is an excellent gimmick : you control multiple characters and must ensure they get to their end zones safely.

Binaries is an excellent example of a game finding an idea, sticking to it, and sucking the possibilities of that idea dry in a rather satisfying way. While Binaries has a lot of reasonably interesting elements outside of the level design, such as the colour palette and animations (which certainly do work to the games minimalistic style) and the humour and meta commentary (which often does not), the core mechanic and the levels built around it are the main thrust of the game, and it that regard, Binaries is pure excellent genius.

Binaries manages that all too rare thing : somehow giving you a very reasonable difficulty curve that is tough, but rarely controller-breakingly frustrating. New elements to the gameplay are introduced at a rate that feels just about perfect, not giving the player too much too soon, while also not overusing the same puzzle element too much. As a whole, the vast majority of the levels (and their additional optional goals) were enjoyable to complete and replay. Well worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013146396', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 2129, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1617864404}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038085628', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1552409122}
review:
This is a tough one to rate. Actually, no it isn't. I wouldn't recommend a 5/10.

Binaries is a platformer where you control multiple units at once. Therefore the game is very disorientating for most of the levels, and can feel very annoyingly just like you have to use trial and error. There are also a lot of nicely designed levels that are fun to figure out.

The problem I had was that by the time I had 100% completion, I was only just starting to feel like I was getting good at the main mechanic of the game: being able to watch and move two units at once (the last thing I had to do was replay some of the first levels to beat the time trials). For the rest of the game a lot of the time I'd just been swapping which unit I was looking at and learning by trial and error where was safe to land for the others. So now I'm finished and don't feel like I have fully been tested on the skill the game has given me.

There's too many lazy levels and bad design choices (that the in game subtitle commentary tries and fails to make uniquely comedic) and also a couple of very minor bugs like getting stuck going through small gaps and sometimes not dying to projectiles.

There's no workshop/user-made levels. The aesthetic's alright. The music is nothing special. Took me about 7 hours to 100% over a couple of months.

Get it if you really like trial and error and want to try platforming with multiple units at once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082401360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1535973092}
review: Finally I've found one of the fairest challenges on Steam. The description and reviews promised the game to be difficult and infuriating, but I had only fun without rage (except 06x18) even when I tried to complete all levels on S rank. Best combination of testing your strategy thinking and reflexes in so simple manner. Recommend if you want to buy two different platformers for the price of one game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197965967005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1523571538}
review:
It's just really, really clever. One of those puzzle-platformers that walks the right line between frustration (in a good way) and making you feel like a genius when you make progress. I occasionally felt like I needed to rewire my brain, but that made success all the more rewarding.

Good sense of humour, too. It often put a smile on my face :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072434623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1523310005}
review:
Jeu plaisant de puzzle platformer.
On peut y revenir de temps à autre, pas besoin d'enchainer. C'est même trop fatiguant nerveusement et intellectuellement avec certains tableaux.
Durée de vie longue de ce fait.
Et pour les plus habiles, un bon challenge pour aller jusqu'à la fin et en faisant des bons temps.

On pourrait lui reprocher que le déblocage de niveau est assez linéaire, donc il faut avancer pour tous les voir. Mais comme un tableau peu en débloquer plusieurs, peu de chance d'être réellement bloqué sur un qui vous résiste

author: {'steamid': '76561198214125649', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1641153430}

A really good game ! It's pretty hard but with some time and patience you can get over it! The musics are really amazing, the gameplay is pretty good and the graphics too!
The texts and jokes in each level really add something aswell, it gives a... soul to an otherwise little empty game.

Couldn't finish it yet but I'm on the way!

--Edit--
I finished it (some time ago already) and yeah, was an amazing experience, 100% is hard but at least it feels rewarding, really great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1627228288}
review:
A seamless merge between a good rage platformer (of the super meat boy type) and a good puzzle game. And I do mean seamless.

If you look at the trailer and think there's any chance that this game might be fun and interesting, I assure you it lives up to its full potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016747572', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1561696267}
review:
■どんなゲーム？

赤と青のボールは、左右にキーを入力すれば一緒に左右に、スペースキーを押せば一緒にジャンプする。
ゴールは模様のついたところに同時に対応した色のところに入らなければならない
即死トラップのトゲは、自分と同じ色なら発動し、
違う色ならトゲの上に乗れるし、ボール同士で足場となってジャンプすることもできる。

■ゲーム難易度
・クリア自体難しい面もあるが、多めのルートが用意されたマップにより後回しにもできる
・クリアへのルートは１つ１つのボールの高低差、ゴールの位置などを考慮し
　時に壁にひっかけたりしながら調整する必要もでてくる　
・Ｂ，Ａ、Ｓのタイムによってランクが決まり、死亡数も記録される
　・こういうアクションゲームによくあるコース上のコインのような、ものは
　　獲得するとタイムが縮まるので、獲得必須ではなく、高ランク向けになっている

・マップ上で互いのボールの会話が英語で表示されるがなかなか見ている暇がないのが残念

author: {'steamid': '76561197998690550', 'num_games_owned': 1147, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1505489145}
review:
One of the tags for this game says “difficult”. Normally it would mean avoiding lightning-fast sawblades, navigating penny-sized platforms that executing pixel-perfect moves. Not here though – all jumps are easy, deadly sparks are rather slow and timing in general is quite relaxed. But make no mistake, this game IS difficult – for a totally different reason. All those jumps and dodges you’ll have to do, you do for two (or more) balls simultaneously. With only one set of controls to do it.

You ever heard of how difficult it is to simultaneously “tap you head and rub your tummy” or “draw circle with one hand and triangle with another”? That’s exactly the skill this game will put to the test. This is multitasking brought to the extreme, this is the ultimate twofer, this is the stone to kill two birds with.

Level design definitely deserves a praise too. With 101 levels, developers really explored the concept of simultaneous control to the fullest, finding time and time again in what particular way it goes against any instinct you had so far.
Add minimalistic, but very clean design, simple, but appropriate soundtrack – and you not only swearing and breaking your keyboard, but doing it in stylish and relaxing environment.

All in all – “Binaries” is puzzle platformer with rather unique twist in it for those who have seen it all. Sure, you have defeated Dr. Fetus or whoever it is the hardest platformer boss out there. This time your enemy is your own brain. Fight!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273720151', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1570397595}

author: {'steamid': '76561198300270231', 'num_games_owned': 5388, 'num_reviews': 894, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1496500999}
review:
당신의 멘탈을 개박살 내버릴 퍼즐 플랫폼이 왔다. 이름하여 [b]《바이너리즈》[/b]. 이 게임에서 당신이 얻을 수 있는 건 깊은 빡침밖에 없을 것이다. 민감한 조작에 대한 빡침, 타임 어택에 따라 나뉘는 등급의 압박감에 대한 빡침, 그걸 하지 않으면 도전과제 올클리어는 불가능하다는 걸 알았을 때의 빡침 등 당신의 멘탈을 박살내버릴 펀치가 언제든지 날아올 것이다!

 + 레벨의 수가 진짜 존나게 많다(볼륨이 크다는 뜻이니 장점이긴 한데, 나에겐  개같기만 하다)
 + 트레이딩 카드 존재(당신이 게임을 포기하지 않는다면, 플탐 대비 파밍시간 빠른 편)
 
 - 스트레스 유발의 가장 큰 지분을 차지하는 타임어택 '등급' 시스템
 - 등급이 있으니 당연히 '모든 레벨 S등급으로 달성' 도전과제가 존재하네?
 - 근데 등급을 제쳐두고도 클리어하는 거 자체가 개빡치는 레벨도 존재하네?
 - 개같이 민감한 조작이 스트레스에 박차를 가한다
 
 가볍게 즐길 게임은 절대 아니다. 라이트 유저는 절대 사지 말고, 한 게임을 깊이 파는 매니아라도 결코 호락호락한 게임이 아니다. 아마 이 게임을 올클리어하는데에는 꽤 많은 시간이 소요될 것 같다 시브럴.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3960, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1494097420}
review:
Binaries est un redoutable jeu de réflexion, d'action et de réflexe avec une difficulté parfois redoutable.

On dirige une boule bleue et une boule orange auxquelles on doit faire traverser un parcours en 2D jusqu'à l'emplacement désigné pour chaque boule. Il faut éviter les pièges sinon c'est perdu et il faut recommencer.

Le truc, c'est qu'on contrôle simultanément les 2 boules !

Il faut donc bien réfléchir avant d'appuyer sur les touches (gauche, droit, saut et c'est tout) car si la progression peut être réussie pour une boule, ça peut être la cata pour l'autre.

Il y a de très nombreux niveaux qui assurent une belle durée de vie, d'autant plus que certains sont vraiment très difficiles. Heureusement, on débloque à chaque succès plusieurs nouveaux niveaux et on peut donc toujours choisir celui auquel on va se mesurer sans être coincé par un défi trop démotivant. Les runs sont chronométrées pour ceux qui veulent améliorer leurs reconrds ou comparer leurs performances avec leurs amis.

J'avais précisément laissé un peu ce jeu de côté car je m'acharnais en vain sur un niveau mais j'ai retrouvé le plaisir en réussissant d'autres niveaux au point que je recommande déjà ce jeu alors que je ne suis qu'à 10% de progression.


Bref, un jeu addictif avec un vrai challenge mais avec des niveaux de difficultés différentes qui pourra ainsi convenir à tout le monde. Je recommande chaudement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1491767506}
review:
This is a great puzzle-platformer. The core part of the game that makes for difficulty is the fact that you basically have to control two chracters at once, but with the same controls. You need to be able to either (or both) plan in advance and quickly react to dangers faced by both the characters.

The art in this game is simple, and goes well with the soundtrack. The levels are easy to understand (as in, you can quickly identify where the dangers are to plan for them), but definitely not easy to beat. The addition of a timer adds to the difficulty quite well.

Good game, definitely plays best with a controller, and I would say there are the right amount of levels to let you swap between if you get stuck on one in particular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119196299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1492980598}
review: I hate this game so much it's not even funny, but that's why I love it. I always strive to find the most difficult, annoying and vicious games to play. And yes, this game isn't all that vicious, but at times it may make you want to tear off your genetalia and sodomize yourself with the now removed member. The game is very easy to get into, runs smoothly on almost any machine, has fantastic, colorful visuals, a vibrant soundtrack and entertaining conversation from the game itself. I find myself feeling confident when the game says to me, "I believe in you." Like... Props to whoever put that in because... Thank you, I believe in me too now. This is a great casual game to burn some time and get your blood preasure burning. If you have suicidal thoughts, this game will only accelerate your eventual death, and that's what makes it great. 9/10, only complaint is it could use some more choice with the colors.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067531992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1488311418}
review:
Binaries is a unique jump and run game with a great soundtrack, focused on fast level completion, as you will notice some awkward controls when you try to be slow and precise.
If you find yourself unable to beat a level, you'll always have at least one other level to try your luck on. If you have some time to kill, this certainly is a great game to do so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085405844', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1485889003}
review: Jesteś aż dwoma kulkami ;) Później, czterema i ... (nie napisze, sam zagraj) niebieską i żółtą. Celem gry jest dojść jednocześnie żółtą kulką do żółtej bazy, a niebieską do niebieskiej. Wydaje się proste, ale takie nie jest. Przeszkadzają kolce, latające gwiazdki, ruchome ściany... i jednocześnie patrzenie na 2-4-x różnych bohaterów. Gra zawiera 101 planszy, cześć jest frustrujących, ale po 20-50 śmierciach można przejść, ćwiczy cierpliwość i dłuuuugo się w nią gra. Warto wydać na nią 10$, chociaż można było dostać za 5$.

review: Only just started now that it's finally out for Linux (it works great, by the way) and I'm finding it challenging already. It's one of those games you can pick and put down at any time and that's exactly what I need. No doubt I'll be chipping away at this for a very long time. I consider that money well-spent. When I got my wife started on it, I was only out of the room for 2 minutes before I started hearing some colourful language through the wall. That is just a testament to its brilliance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074672646', 'num_games_owned': 6653, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1460012232}
review:
[h1]Binaries est composé de plus de 100 niveaux[/h1]

Dans Binaries, votre objectif est de placer la boule orange dans le but orange et la boule bleue, dans le but bleu.

Rien de difficile jusqu’ici.

Là où ça se complique, c’est que vous contrôlez toutes les boules en même temps. Quand une va à droite, l’autre va à droite aussi.

Evidemment, une boule orange sur des piques oranges, c’est perdu ! Heureusement, une boule orange, sur des piques bleus, vous n’avez rien à craindre et pour l’inverse aussi (une boule bleue sur des piques oranges).

Dans Binaries, il ne faut pas avoir peur de perdre et de recommencer, et de rerecommencer et encore et toujours encore. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=668740404

[url=www.graal.fr/2016/04/08/test-binaries-la-version-pour-steam/]Pour lire toutes mes impressions sur Binaries.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198062232099', 'num_games_owned': 5821, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1460515397}
review:
Binaries is the Steam debut of Ant Workshop Ltd, a tiny indie video game developer and game consultancy firm that is based in beautiful Edinburgh, Scotland. They carefully chose the name of their studio after ants because, in their words, they are ‘small, sociable and very hardworking.’ Though I wasn’t able to confirm their size through communications with them I was able to confirm that they are definitely friendly and the amount of work that has gone into making Binaries one of the smartest new puzzle-platformers on Steam attests to their hardworking nature.

It is this hardworking nature that definitely pays off with the quality of their game. It’s a game where you are tasked at guiding two cute through brightly colored challenges. Although I bring into question the game’s validity of being the first concentration platform game – which it bills itself as being on its website – it definitely made me concentrate a lot more than I thought that I was going to do throughout the game.

With 101 levels contained within the game there is certainly more than enough content to justify the $9.99 price tag. In fact, I would go so far as to suggest that when the game is on any multiple figure discount that the game should be considered an absolute bargain. It’s not just a quantity over quality type equation for the game either. Every level that I have played through feels as though it belongs and hasn’t simply been added to the game to bump up the arbitrary number of levels. It’s certainly a case of quality and quantity here.

I quite enjoyed the fact that the game has a non-linear map. Certain levels are colored blue and others are orange. I’m unsure whether this is intended to signify that one level is harder than another or not but you do need to control balls of both colors through every level. Perhaps the reason that I do not know the answer to this question is because I was having too much fun and I was quickly selecting the next level and the next and so on. Unlike many infuriating platformer games where you have no choice in what level you play next you and has you quitting because you cannot defeat that next level having the choice of picking another level makes the game player friendly.

There’s an enormous amount of replayability within the game. With timed awards for each level – S, A and B – you will constantly find yourself returning to previous levels to best your personal bests. Even when you have unlocked S on a level you may feel as though you’re capable of beating your best time.

The presentation of the graphics and the sound are top notch. The developer added the soundtrack to Steam as purchasable DLC because there was a demand for it among the playing base. The game’s music changes dependent upon how you are faring in each level. If you’re playing poorly it will slow down and try to aide your concentration but if you’re doing superbly well the soundtrack can become quite frantic and will help keep you in the zone.

Finally, the game has been Steamified with trading cards and Steam achievements.

What more could you possibly ask for from a puzzle-platformer? This game is fantastic and is highly addictive.

For more reviews and our popular giveaways please visit [url=http://www.steamified.com]Steamified.com[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561197960288160', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1458305829}
review:
Binaries is a puzzle platformer with a simple concept which rapidly intensifies into a really challenging series of puzzles.

This is a very well-designed game - every level seems to introduce a new concept or mechanic. Each time you think you've seen all that can be done, a level appears with something new to keep things fresh. It's a masterpiece of level design. If you get stuck there are always plenty of levels to try instead on the level select screen.

There are 101 levels, each with par time rankings to beat. Developer will be adding global rankings (among other requested features) which the speedrunners and streamers should love.

Highly recommend you pick this up and see if you're as good at puzzle games as you think you are.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994912071', 'num_games_owned': 1427, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1487796297}
review: Fun platformer that rapidly progresses from "this doesn't seem so hard" to "WHAT IS THIS AND WHAT IS MY LIFE?!". In theory you have time to think between each action, but in reality you're going to end up throwing yourself into it and hoping your reflexes can keep up. Trust me on this, tracking two balls seems straightforward but it is a recipe for ragequitting. The visual style is simple and slick, with everything you see providing you with a piece of information. There's no visual distraction from your task. It can't be emphasised enough how important this is for a game. Overall I'd recommend it if you like this style of platform puzzler or games such as Mercury.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280719843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1462214149}
review: Binaries A very good puzzle platform game its a very interesting the way the map changes and the movement is so different i havent played a game like this before 10/10 i would recomend this to everyone i like all games and its nice to dip into a puzzle platformer goodwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118850003', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1460502758}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7DoCKbqttIQ

I've always been a huge fan of platformers and puzzle games. [i]Binaries[/i] is like the genius love child of the two genres.

The concept is very intriguing: controlling two blocks to get each one to a separate goal. It looks odd on paper, but [i]Binaries[/i] executes it flawlessly. The levels pose a very good challenge, but not to the point of being neigh impossible. I'd say it's more NES hard than [i]I Wanna Be The Guy[/i] hard.

Graphically, it's a damn good looking game. The best way I can describe it is like [i]PAC-MAN™ Championship Edition[/i] - It's minimalistic, but it's beautiful.

The music in this game is phenomenal, so much so that I kinda want to buy the soundtrack. That's something I hardly ever say about any video game, even AAA titles. The sound effects aren't too bad, either.

The game controls marvelously on the XB1 controller. There was never a time when I felt it controlled too loose nor tight, it's right there in the Goldilocks zone where, within two levels, you have the physics down to a T.

Should you buy it? YES! Buy it now! Hell, I'd get the soundtrack along with the game! And seriously, Ant Workshop, you should put this on the console stores. No joke, you would make a killing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020265086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1466453204}
review:
[b]Quick and short version:[/b] Loved it, a great new premise for a puzzle game. Could soak hours into it if you wanted to race friends times. If no friends you might get bored after beating each level once or twice. (See gameplay in video below).

~Overall Score - 8.75/10

[b]Long version:[/b] For a puzzle game I can really admire this. It is a lot different of a game than you might orginally think, innovative you could say to some extent. I've only played about the first 10 levels or so, but I've seen some of the higher levels you can get to in their intro video. I would highly recommend this game if you are a puzzler that likes a challenge, or even if you are a casual gamer that may only have 5 minutes to spare at times.

[list]
[*][b]Gameplay - 10/10 -[/b] For being a puzzle game it sticks to it's guns. You get exactly what you are expecting, besdies some of the levels being tricky, but that is part of the expereince. Figuring out how to beat a level is what makes you want to play it again and again. 101 levels seems like a lot, and it will have you playing for several hours to beat them all, but how many hours more will it take to master them all is another question. You also have the ability to skip levels if you are stuck, which is great to give yourmind a rest when you are too puzzled.

[*][b]Replayability - 8/10 -[/b] Lots, if you like to challenge yourself. The game does have 3 internal rankings S, A, and B in order of highest rank for fastest time possible. If you are one that wants to get that high ranking you will play each level many different times. IF you don't that's where the drop in score comes in, and you can only improve so much before most won't find it as fun to0 grind those small numbers.

[*][b]Graphics - 9/10 -[/b] Not everything needs oto be state of the art, and for being a simple game it gets simple graphics. Although the theme is orange it blue, it could use some sprucing up in color in spots you need need to move on or in the menues. This may just be a personal feel.

[*][b]Controls - 8/10 -[/b] This game does come with controller support, seeing as you move both balls at once it is only as tr4icky to use as you will make it to paly, I didn't try it out though. Although I do find it a bit wonky you can't remap the keys and the only way to jump is either spacebar or the enter key on keyboard mode.[/list]

For more reference and what the first ten levels have in store for you here is a video: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e0oENe7jHJA]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e0oENe7jHJA[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981608349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1460450245}
review: Wonderful game.  It's got the fun and funny factor with the balls and jokes, respectively; that is the attention to detail I like in a game.  Additionally, it's got the challenge of puzzling and logic that makes me feel smarter with each successful level.  Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987506741', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1463558277}
review: 0.2 hours in and I can already tell that I hate this with the passion of a thousand burning suns. But hey, that doesn't mean it's a bad game - quite the contrary, actually. It looks pretty cool, controls well, and is as unforgiving as they come. If you don't mind the challenge, go ahead and buy this game. You'll love to hate it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065962732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1619358651}
review:
Vous savez, j'aime bien les jeux difficiles, j'ai l'ame d'un compétiteur, en gros. C'est toujours gratifiant de terminer un jeu difficile. Cependant il y a un type de difficulté que je déteste, c'est quand un jeu est tellement difficile que malgré les efforts fournis, il n'y aura aucune solution qui est visible.

Binaries ne se contente pas d'être difficile, il offre des niveaux où c'est tellement à la limite de l'impossible qu'il n'y a pas de solutions envisagées, même avec plusieurs (!!) centaines d'essais ! Je n'aurais rien dit si ce jeu aurait été gratuit comme le "I wanna be the guy/t he boshy" et consorts qui n'ont rien à envier à ce jeu point de vue difficulté, mais m**de 9€ que ça coute ce jeu !

Ce jeu dans son principe est plutôt pas mal, mais il y a trop de niveaux dont la difficulté est tellement abominable que ça va vous gacher tout plaisir de jouer.

review:
A citation I heard before is perfect for this game :
This game is as easy as riding a bike, except the bike is on fire, you're on fire, and you're in hell.
Perfect game that just tries to make you crazy

author: {'steamid': '76561198047847143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1480457548}
review:
https://youtu.be/bKkY9G5iF9w

Really awesome puzzler. There is tons of challenge in this game, lots of times to beat and levels to get through. I like the option of different levels on the main screen, in case I get stuck. The graphics are well done and minimalistic, and the game itself is sarcastic and funny. It gives you enough gameplay to keep you interested, even if you cant solve the ever-challenging puzzles that go along with it.
